Posts.Content: Those locks look fab, wish I lived closer to them - I fancy a walk there! Brings back happy memories..... Reminds me of a fun weekend on a canal boat with two friends. I split my jeans when I fell on the tiller after we moored up beside a pub one evening haha.  Must do a canal boat weekend again - when I’m not so bleeping tired!!! Stupid bc.  Wishing everyone a peaceful evening, as free from bc worries as possible and all on the Awake thread a peaceful nights sleep.  Debbie
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Can I gatecrash....I haven’t exactly started to walk much post treatment, but I love seeing all your adventures out and about.  I loved the Magic Roundabout!
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Loving all the piccies.....making me laugh! Especially love the Golden Retrievers. I had one for 15 years. Died years ago....still miss him. Maybe it’s time to get another one .... then he can get me walking back to happiness....xxx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Love this thread! I’m starting radiotherapy next week, so i’ll be walking lots to and from appointments. I’m looking forward to walking for pleasure after it’s all done, hopefully in the sunshine. Keep going everyone!
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi Undergroundbarbie, I’m 11 weeks post WLE and SNB and I have weird and wonderful sensations/discomfort/shooting pains/heavy feeling and a hard lumpy tender scar area too. As everyone has said, it’s all part of the recovery process, nerves knitting etc.  I found it so reassuring to read others were experiencing the same as me. It stopped me being concerned that something was wrong and I wasn’t alone in this.  Dx
Posts.Title: Pain after wide local excision

Posts.Content: Hi Kate, I’ve used normal deodorant on my good side and nothing on my zappy side as that’s what they told me to do. Weirdly since my op and SNB my affected armpit no longer needs any deodorant. I reckon the surgeon may have cut through the those nerves and I no longer sweat - silver lining and all that!  I’m on zap 11 today and all going well still.  Good luck today with your scan.  My ‘warrior tatts’ as I like to call them (3 dot tattoos) didn’t hurt any more than a sharp scratch and it’s over in a blink of an eye.  D x
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Hi Maria, I’ve got the same diagnosis as you - invasive Lobular (mine is stage 2) - all else the same.  I had a lumpectomy and SNB early December. Plan: radio and Tamoxifen.  All’s going well with radio (zap 11 today). I’m using R1 and R2 as Gel/cream.  I got it on prescription from the GP. I know others are doing well using other products though. at my radio review they told me they don’t recommend any specific creams as they all do much of a muchness - moisturise.  I’m still having my lovely daily baths with no ill effect. Yay! @Mandi.....glad your zaps are going well! Have a lovely restful evening everyone. Another day done.  D x
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Hi, I’ve got all my appointments late afternoon....5pm or thereabouts. So will be heading home from London in the rush hour. Fun!! Take care.  Debbie
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Laugh....I was 2 hours and 20 minutes late today for my 2nd zap. They gave me a treatment sheet with dates and times yesterday but as I already had one I just popped it into my bag thinking it was a duplicate. Little did I know they’d changed a lot of the times. So today I was supposed to have been there at 2pm!  They were very sweet about it. I told them I’m hoping to work throughout so could they perhaps not change my times. They said they’d ‘fix’ them for me. Kind!  Hope everyone has a lovely restful evening.  Take care Debbie
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Hi Leigh, I start my radiotherapy on Wednesday too. After reading other posts I’ve got R1 and R2 ready and waiting - just in case!   Good luck to everyone who is ‘zapping their bap’ this month.  Debbie
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: That's great news Jac! First zap over with, what a relief for you. Woohoo.....onwards and upwards! So pleased for you. I don't finish until the 27th, so another 7 zaps to go. I've got a 5pm appointment to look forward to today so will have the joys (not!) of Southeastern railways and the London rush hour.  Good luck to everyone having zaps this week. Hope they go well. Dx
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: HI Jac,  Must say I didn’t enjoy zap 12 today. The machine didn’t behave as usual, it continued making the zapping noise as it travelled across my body from one side to the other. On the other 11 sessions it’s always delivered 2 zaps then stopped, then went quiet as it travelled across my body to deliver 2 more zaps - thats job done.  Has anyone else experienced a difference in the way their zaps are delivered? The radiographer told me she had set the machine to ‘auto’ as my elbows allowed that to happen today.  Weird as my arms are always in the same position in the arm stirrups.  I didn’t know there were different ways to deliver the treatment. It was pretty scary when I thought they were still delivering the zaps as the machine crossed over me. The 2 radiographers were training up a trainee today (they let her position me), maybe this didn’t help me when the machine acted differerently!!  Could have done without this today!  Hope everyone else’s session went better.  D x
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Hi Mandi, I’ll be at Guy’s. When do you start your treatments? My last one is on the 27th Feb. Yippee! Not that I’m wishing my life away but i’ll be a happy bunny when they’re all done. Good luck with yours.   Debbie
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Hi, I’ve just had my 3rd zap. I’ve been advised to use my usual deodorant on my unaffected arm and nothing on my at risk arm.  I’m using R1 and R2 creams after reading on this site that they were effective. All seems ok so far but I know it’s early days yet.  Have a lovely weekend everyone. Keep warm!  Dx
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Happy Valentines Day everyone!  Good luck to everyone starting today.  I’m about to have zap number 6. Apart from a 1.5hr wait on Monday it’s been smooth sailing. No pinkness yet and no tiredness. At my treatment review yesterday I was told this will change by about zap 9 and peak the week or two after rads finish. Maybe i’ll tail off work and start to keep my sofa warm then! Woohoo......box sets for me. Lovely! Have a good day everyone.  Dx
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Hi, I’m also halfway through tomorrow. Glad it’s the weekend soon....Travelling in and out of London in the cold at rush hour isn’t fun!   My boob seems very slightly swollen, but not pink yet or particularly sore. I’m having my usual baths in the morning (I love a good soak) using Simple soap. Am also using my usual deodorant on my good armpit (nothing on my affected one). Tiredness hasn’t hit me as yet, but I’m waiting for it!! I reckon the travelling will be responsible for most of it.  Thank goodness for friends coming with me to keep me company on the trains.  Keep going everyone ..... it’s nearly the weekend.  Dx
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Hi Mandi, luckily once I cadged a lift to the station (calling on friends and hubby for this chore) it’s just one train through to London Bridge. I’m starting this coming Wednesday at 5pm, so hoping it might warm up a bit (Really don’t like this cold weather!). I’m working this week for the first 3 zaps but then I plan to take it easy for the following couple of weeks.  Leigh - sorry to hear you have to have chemo tablets after radio. I’m starting Tamoxifen when I finish. Wish we could all just get zapped and then that would be that. Still.....as you say our teams know what’s best for us.  It’s lovely we can all support each other during all this.   Debbie
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: I had my first zap at 5.30pm tonight. Was all over very quickly. The worst thing was the journey home from London. Sardines on the train at rush hour. Joy!!  I have an earlier appointment at 4.20pm tomorrow and Friday so hoping for a seat on the train.  So.....I’ve put my cream on and drank loads of fluid and am pleased the first one is over.  Good luck everyone going through this. Thinking of you all.  Debbie
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Hi Chaza, I didn't worry about putting R2 on before my first visit. Straight after all my zaps I put the R1 on and then when I got home an hour or so later I put the R2 on and again before bed (all my appointments were late afternoon). I put the R2 cream on when I woke up and again at lunchtime, then washed it all off before my next zap.   Hope it all goes well for you, hopefully you will not have snow to contend with! Take care Dx
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Hi Chaza, You will find the 3 weeks pass pretty quickly. It’s the journey to and from hospital that lots of us find a bit dreary. Hope your journey is short and easy.  Take care Dx
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Hi Louis7, Having a deep hot bath every morning sets me up for the day. So far it hasn’t affected my skin (had 8 zaps). I’m using R1 (a gel) straight after my zap in the hospital, then slap R2 (a cream) on when I get home and before bed.  I’m having all my zaps around 5pm as I’m trying to work.  It was some of amazingly lovely women on this site who recommended this gel/cream and so far so good. I also have my boob out quite a lot in the evening when I’m watching TV to keep it cool (husband likes this new development!) and haven’t worn a bra since my op (I haven’t got big boobs and have even less now!!).  Maybe all these little things are helping, along with drinking 2 litres of fluid a day or maybe I’ve just been lucky so far. I’ll see what the next 7 zaps do to me.  Keep brave and strong. Enjoy another day of no hospital appointments! Big hugs Debbie
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢
